page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY/ Clipston 1900
page.content: Life in the home was very different 85 years ago. Children had to help their parents a great deal. One of their many jobs was to get sticks for the fire which was the only source of heat and also used to cook over. They had to collect water from one of the pumps, as piped water was not introduced until the Second World War. Monday was a very busy day for all the family, as it was wash day. This meant the copper had to be filled, and the fire kept going underneath to heat the water. Heavy irons had to be kept warm to press the clothes when they were dry. The normal chores of the day still had to be carried out. People in general, worked very hard in those days as there was none of the modern machinery we take so for granted today to help us with our chores.
